name: Man vs Mountain (Yr Wyddfa)

difficulty.label: Very Hard
difficulty.technical: Mountain trails with significant ascent to Wales' highest peak

description: Man vs Mountain is the ultimate showdown between runner and Wales' highest peak. Starting in Llanberis, the route climbs to the summit of Yr Wyddfa (Snowdon) at 1,085m before descending back to the finish. With a mix of technical mountain paths, loose rock, and stunning ridgeline running, this is pure mountain racing at its finest. The views from the summit on a clear day stretch to Ireland, the Isle of Man, and the Lake District. But this race isn't about the sceneryâ€”it's about conquering the mountain. Whether you race the clock or race yourself, crossing that finish line after summiting Snowdon is an achievement to treasure.
who_its_for: Trail runners with mountain experience. Good fitness essential. Not recommended for beginners or those uncomfortable on exposed mountain terrain.
whats_special: Summit of Yr Wyddfa (Snowdon) - Wales' highest peak
Part of Always Aim High Events calendar
mandatory_kit: Waterproof jacket with hood and taped seams
